title: England player ratings from New Zealand triumph in Rugby World Cup 2019 semi-final
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest daily news stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

England produced one of their greatest-ever displays to storm into the World Cup final with a 19-7 victory over New Zealand that reduced the reigning champions to a rabble.

From the moment Manu Tuilagi crossed after 97 seconds an extraordinary match beckoned and the final scoreline did little justice to the domination of Eddie Jones' men, who were superior in every single facet of the game.

New Zealand had won their previous 18 World Cup matches dating back to 2007 but at International Stadium Yokohama they were flattened by a juggernaut led by the unstoppable Maro Itoje.

England will face either South Africa or Wales in next Saturday's final and having crushed the odds-on favourites to win the Webb Ellis Trophy, they will be expected to repeat their solitary triumph of 2003.

Here are England player ratings....

(Image: REUTERS)

ENGLAND

Elliot Daly 7

Missed a long-range penalty but otherwise got his positional play right all match. Slick.

Anthony Watson 7

Always seemed to find pockets of space to make a gain every time on the wing.

Manu Tuilagi 8

Got England off to the perfect start with his early try. Made sure England won the midfield battle.

(Image: PA)

Owen Farrell 7

Hobbled around in the first half but bravely played on and dictated play.

Jonny May 7

Some monster hits and England lost some of their attacking flair when he went off.

George Ford 8

A wand of a right foot. Just one penalty miss all evening. Dominated the game from fly-half.

(Image: REUTERS)

Ben Youngs 8

Unfortunate to have a cheeky try ruled out but otherwise a solid performance.

Mako Vunipola 8

Led from the front line. Put his body on the line at every oppurtinuty.

Jamie George 6

Never seemed to really find the pace of the game and gave his side a worrying moment with an overthrow.

(Image: AFP via Getty Images)

Kyle Sinckler 7

Forced off with an injury but worked hard at the breakdown.

Maro Itoje 9

Hit after hit after hit. Hard to think of a tackle he missed all game. Massive performance.

Courtney Lawes 8

Pure power. Was at his best at the line-up, where England dominated.

(Image: Getty Images)

Tom Curry 8

Immense alongside Underhill. Did more than anyone to disrupt New Zealand.

Sam Underhill 9 MOTM

Superhero display. Seemed to be everywhere in attack and defence with some incredible tackles. Every All Black will have a bruise from his shoulders. His disallowed would simply have been a cherry on his night.

Billy Vunipola

On his 50th appearance probably put in his best performance. Masterclass.

Replacements - The cavalry provided momentum at a time when New Zealand were already beaten. Henry Slade put in a shift at full-back. 8
description: England stunned New Zealand with a superb display to reach the Rugby World Cup final
